Issues.Title: Fix #3985 change net5.0 to net5.0-windows and net6.0 to net6.0-windows
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #3985 


## Proposed changes

- Change the option of available TFM when creating new winforms project to use `net5.0-windows` or `net6.0-windows`
- Also update the base csproj and vbproj files to be adjusted as `FrameworkParameter` and `TargetFrameworkOverride` according to the TFM, therefore there should be no `FrameworkParameter-windows` and `TargetFramework-windows` anymore
- 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- During new project creation, we must always specify explicit `net5.0-windows` instead of `net5.0` and `net6.0-windows` instead of `net6.0`.
- 

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal, as the new winforms project creation will always specify explicit `net5.0-windows` instead of `net5.0` and `net6.0-windows` instead of `net6.0`.

Issues.Title: Consume intellisense from internal nuget package
Issues.Body:
This PR removes the download from Azure blob storage in favor of consuming the official package released by the docs team. It will enables us to easily rev versions for future releases without having to do any other manual steps.

This is based off of work in the runtime repo at https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/688206b76481d00a61110d9f28218cb2bc58957c/eng/restore/docs.targets

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Inspect should be focus on the entire listView item row, not the first item when ListView's FullRowSelect = true
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20522.5

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More Info:
This is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net Core 3.1

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached WinFormsApp12.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[WinFormsApp12.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5426925/WinFormsApp12.zip)
2. Launch Inspect to focus on ListView items

**Actual behavior:**
Inspect focus on the first list item, not entire listView Item row when its FullRowSelect is true
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/96949258-14f70c80-151a-11eb-938c-2439884a2761.png)

**Expected behavior:**
Inspect focus on entire listView Item row when its FullRowSelect is true
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/96949344-44a61480-151a-11eb-8b8e-cde87b4a8f4a.png)

Issues.Title: Fresh winforms project in VS can't load the winforms designer
Issues.Body:
Using VS 2019 preview 16.8.0 preview 5.0

I created a new winforms project (.net core 3.1). Trying to open the form in the designer, I get a VS error letting me know that details are in the activity log xml file:

![forms1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50608/96906283-95106a00-1467-11eb-8941-8dfe4c60600b.png)

In the xml file:

CreateInstance failed for package [Windows Forms Remote Designer Hosting Package]Source: 'mscorlib' Description: Could not load type 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.Design.VSDesignPackage' from assembly 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.Package, Version=0.3.2.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'.
System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.Design.VSDesignPackage' from assembly 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.Package, Version=0.3.2.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'.
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.GetType(RuntimeAssembly assembly, String name, Boolean throwOnError, Boolean ignoreCase, ObjectHandleOnStack type)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.GetType(String name, Boolean throwOnError, Boolean ignoreCase)
   at System.Activator.CreateInstanceFromInternal(String assemblyFile, String typeName, Boolean ignoreCase, BindingFlags bindingAttr, Binder binder, Object[] args, CultureInfo culture, Object[] activationAttributes, Evidence securityInfo)
   at System.AppDomain.CreateInstanceFrom(String assemblyFile, String typeName)

VS also displays this:

![forms2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50608/96906218-82963080-1467-11eb-81ea-f4a9b8aa07e8.png)

Any idea?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fresh winforms project in VS can't load the winforms designer" (#4148)

Issues.Title: Steema.TeeChart.NETCore.WinForm control is not fully supported by current version of Windows Forms Designer for .NET Core
Issues.Body:
- .NET Core Version:
   3.1.9


- Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:
   No

**Problem description**:
I've created .NET Core WinForms application and added **Steema.TeeChart.NETCore.WinForm** nuget-package.
As I can see Steema.TeeChart.NETCore.WinForm control is not fully supported by current version of Windows Forms Designer for .NET Core even in latest Visual Studio 2019 16.8.0 Preview 4 (some menu items are missing in .NET Core 3.1.9):

![a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/96782759-2fa67580-13a2-11eb-8f21-f2de18f8fbfb.png)

Same menu in .NET Framework 4.8 looks like:
![b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/96782874-37661a00-13a2-11eb-9082-4addfc6402ea.png)

[Some more info](https://www.steema.com/support/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=17436#p77609)
[Sample repo](https://github.com/bairog/TeeChartTest)

What is the expected timeframe for Windows Forms Designer for .NET Core to fully support third-party components? Is it finally going to be happend in Visual Studio 2019 16.8 in November 2020?

P. S. I've tried to email that problem to @OliaG, but 5 days had no answer.

Thank you.

**Expected behavior:**
Functional parity with Windows Forms Designer for .NET Framework.

Issues.Title: Fix Application.EnableVisualStyles in single file publishing mode
Issues.Body:
Application.EnableVisualStyles gives Windows a manifest that enables the v6 common controls. We normally pull this manifest from a native resource in System.Windows.Forms.dll. In single file mode there is no "dll" to load from so this feature was not working as intended.

In the case where we can't get a Win32 HMODULE we now fall back to pulling the manifest from a managed resource and dumping it to the temp folder.

Make ACTCTXW blittable.

Fixes #4145

Issues.Title: Add IsRootSiteInDesignMode for Control
Issues.Body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Folks need a more reliable way to check, if a control is currently in `DesignMode`. The Problem is that the `DesignMode` property of Control does only return true, if the current control is actually sited, and then returns the `DesignMode` property of the Site. In many cases, that does not help: Whenever a control is part of a constituent control (like the `TextBox` control in `NumericUpDown`) or a UserControl, the individual controls making up the UserControl (constituent control) never get sited, and although there is a Site technically which could return `true` for `DesignMode`, from the perspective of that control, that never happens.

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**

`IsRootSiteInDesignMode` would find the _sited_ root (parent) control, test for that being sited and return `DesignMode`, thus a rather reliable way for a control to test if it is in design mode.

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**

No.

Practically, it could be looking something like this:

```
        protected bool IsRootSiteInDesignMode =>
            GetSitedParentSite(this) is ISite parentSite ? parentSite.DesignMode : false;

        private ISite GetSitedParentSite(Control control) =>
            control is null
                ? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(control))
                : control.Site != null || control.Parent is null
                    ? control.Site
                    : GetSitedParentSite(control.Parent);
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add IsRootSiteInDesignMode for Control" (#4146)

Issues.Title: Visual Styles not enabled when app published as 'Self-contained' + 'Produce Single File'
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Problem description:**

Application.EnableVisualStyles() does not enable Visual Styles when the application is published as 'Self-contained' + 'Produce Single File'.

The probable root cause is that ```typeof(Application).Assembly.Location``` returns an empty string for this scenario on .NET 5.
Note that on .NET Core 3.1 it returns a temporary file location.


**Minimal repro:**
Create simplest WinForms .NET 5 App.
In Form1 ctor add following sample code to show the result:
```Text = "UseVisualStyles=" + Application.UseVisualStyles.ToString() + "; " + typeof(Application).Assembly.Location;```

Publish app:
- Target Framework: net5.0-windows
- Deployment mode: Self-contained
- Target Runtime: win-x64
- File publish options: Produce single file
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Visual Styles not enabled when app published as 'Self-contained' + 'Produce Single File'" (#4145)

Issues.Title: VS should not bloat SDK project files with resx designer entries
Issues.Body:
(Copied from https://developercommunity2.visualstudio.com/myfeedback?port=1025&fsid=9bbd6d1d-30dd-4380-b94e-af5035a8459d&entry=myfeedback where I was told to report this here instead)

With the new SDK file format, my team was excited to say goodbye to bloated csproj files using the new globbing feature. For example, to include resx files we use the following glob:

```
<!--Configure .resx files as embedded resources with generated . Designer.cs files.-->
<ItemGroup>
<Compile Update="**\*. Designer.cs">
<AutoGen>True</AutoGen>
<DesignTime>True</DesignTime>
<DependentUpon>$([System.String]::Copy('%(FileName)'). Replace('. Designer', '.resx'))</DependentUpon>
</Compile>
<EmbeddedResource Update="**\*.resx">
<Generator>ResXFileCodeGenerator</Generator>
<LastGenOutput>$([System.String]::Copy('%(FileName)')). Designer.cs</LastGenOutput>
</EmbeddedResource>
</ItemGroup>
<LastGenOutput>$([System.String]::Copy('%(FileName)')). Designer.cs</LastGenOutput>
</EmbeddedResource>
```

Unfortunately, when we add new resx files to the project VS insists on still adding an entry for each designer file like:

```
<Compile Update="Globalization\TestResx.Designer.cs">
<DesignTime>True</DesignTime>
<AutoGen>True</AutoGen>
<DependentUpon>TestResx.resx</DependentUpon>
</Compile>
```

It would be great if VS could handle this more gracefully, either by detecting that the designer file is already getting configured in the same way or by emitting a single glob entry that covers all similar designers if one is not already present (not sure how feasible the latter is if you have multiple kinds of designer files).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "VS should not bloat SDK project files with resx designer entries" (#4144)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/5.0] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#4140)

Issues.Title: ComponentActionsType is defined in the incorrect namespace
Issues.Body: It appears that this was completely accidental, but the `ComponentActionsType` is declared in the incorrect namespace in .NET Core. On .NET Framework, it was declared in `System.ComponentModel.Design` but is declared in `System.Windows.Forms.Design` in .NET Core. This type is intended to be used the `DesignerActionService.GetComponents(...)` method, which is correctly declared in `System.ComponentModel.Design`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ComponentActionsType is defined in the incorrect namespace" (#4137)

Issues.Title: Using source generators for interop
Issues.Body:
This issue is for tracking usage of source generators for interop.

The Runtime is considering implementing P/Invoke support through source generators: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/master/docs/design/features/source-generator-pinvokes.md

We should also be exploring is implementing common patterns via source generators. Things like:

- Handling common buffer usage patterns (buffer growth, movement from stack to heap, etc.)
- Generating resource scoping boilerplate (see our various scope types and how we switch between class and struct for tracking proper disposal in debug builds)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using source generators for interop" (#4136)

Issues.Title: Utilize function pointers for interop
Issues.Body:
Function pointers provide better performance. Creating this issue to discuss utilizing them in Windows Forms interop.

Things we should consider / look at:

- Win32 callbacks
- High usage COM interfaces
- ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Utilize function pointers for interop" (#4135)

Issues.Title: A warning dialog pops up when setting SelectedImageIndex property to '(none)' in TreeNode Editor
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
NET SDK 5.0.100-rtm.20515.8

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info:**

1. This issue also occurs when setting ImageIndex property in TreeNode Editor.
2. This issue cannot repro when targeting 3.0&3.1.
3. This is a regression issue, it cannot repro in .NET 5.0.100-rc.1.20452.10.

**Problem description:**
A warning dialog pops up when setting SelectedImageIndex property to '(none)' in TreeNode Editor. 
![TreeView](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/96392839-e0204800-11ef-11eb-9515-147755055b8e.gif)
![SelectedINdex](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54019172/96392868-f29a8180-11ef-11eb-9451-026b3d6e369c.png)

**Expected behavior:**
No warning dialog pops up and SelectedImageIndex can be successfully set to '(none)'.

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create a winforms .Net Core application with a TreeView control
2. Open smart tag of TreeView, click 'Edit Nodes' to open TreeNode Editor
3. Click 'Add Root' button to add a tree node, in the right table, try to change its SelectedImageIndex property to '(none)'
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A warning dialog pops up when setting SelectedImageIndex property to '(none)' in TreeNode Editor" (#4131)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility]Inspect: The MSAA structure of NumericUpdown/DomainUpDown in Core is missing some children nodes
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net 6.0.100-alpha.1.20516.5

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info:**
This issue cannot repro on .Net Core 3.1. 

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create a .NET Core project with a Label control and change the text to ‘numericUpDown’.
2. Add a NumericUpDown control to form.
3. Build and run the core project.
4. Open the Inspect tool and observe the NumericUpDown control on MSAA mode.

Or 

1. Extract the “MSAA_Numeric&Domain.zip” and open it in VS.
[MSAA_Numeric&Domain.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5398625/MSAA_Numeric.Domain.zip)

2. Build and run the core project.
3. Open the Inspect tool and observe the NumericUpDown control on MSAA mode.

**Actual behavior:**
The MSAA structure of NumericUpdown/DomainUpDown in Core is missing some children nodes.
![Core_5 0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864017/96393447-b5cf8a00-11f1-11eb-806b-1490a52205a8.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The MSAA structure of NumericUpdown/DomainUpDown in Core is correct, it should be like Core 3.1:
![core_3 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864017/96393454-ba943e00-11f1-11eb-8bba-92eb7dbfaf4f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility]Inspect: The MSAA structure of NumericUpdown/DomainUpDown in Core is missing some children nodes" (#4130)

Issues.Title: DataGridView Memory Leaks
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 5.0.100 rc1
<!-- e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info` -->

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No
<!-- Yes / No -->

**Problem description:**
When the app run, per cell click in DataGridView even at VerticalScrollBar, when i looked at Task Manager, the app drains memory 10 to 30 MB per click before automatic reclaim at 590 MB
<!--
    Describe the current behavior, what is wrong or not working as expected.
    Provide as much information as possible, including callstack for crashes/exceptions, screenshots or animations.
  -->


**Expected behavior:**
Memory should not leaks

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a winforms app. Add to Form1 a DataGridView, a PictureBox and two Button (browse and save) control
2. Form1 Load method, get data from Northwind Categories table with a DataTable using SqlDataReader and bind it to DataGridView.
3. Form1 Load method, set DataGridImageColumn.ImageLayout = Zoom at picture column, DataGridView.AutoSizeRowsMode =DisplayedCellsExceptHeaders
4. Button Browse Click method, using OpenFileDialog to get the image from Libraries\Picture\Sample Pictures such as Hydrangeas, Lighthouse etc with size < 1MB.
5. Button Save Click method, add some new records using SqlCommand
6. Run the app, click a cell in DataGridView or at VerticalScrollBar and take a look at Task Manager
7. Memory not leaks with default image from Northwind Catagories table. It leaks when DataGridView shows data with new JPEG Image
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridView Memory Leaks" (#4129)

Issues.Title: DomainUpDown/NumericUpdown should be KeyboardFocusable
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4123

I tracked the current behavior to this PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2382

## Proposed changes

- DomainUpDown/NumericUpdown should return true when queried for IsKeyboardFocusablePropertyId and they are visible and enabled. This is the behavior of the base class, so we shouldn't override it here.

## Regression? 

- Yes.

## Risk

- Someone might be relying on the current behavior.

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- I didn't test this.

Issues.Title: Fixing issue with getting of textbox from DataGridViewTextBoxCell  by Accessibility Insights
Issues.Body:
Fixes #3925


## Proposed changes
- Added logic for restoring of parent during reattaching of EditingControlAccessibleObject. 
- Added unit tests

## Customer Impact
Fixed issue with hanging of Accessibility Insights during getting of data about textbox from DataGridViewTextBoxCell

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk
- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->
- Manually 

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->
- Narrator
- Inspector
- Accessibility Insights

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- .NET Core 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14
